A4.text: He released 'Love Yourself' as the third single from the album, which became an international hit and topped charts in countries around the world.

A5.text: He released 'Sorry' as the second single from the album, which became an international hit and topped charts in countries around the world.

A6.text: On the chart dated 7 May 2016, 'Love Yourself' spent its 23rd consecutive week in the Hot 100's top ten, breaking the record for the most consecutive weeks logged in the top 10 from a song's debut, previously set by Nicki Minaj's 'Starships', Maroon 5's 'Sugar' and Bieber's both 'What Do You Mean?'

A7.text: 'Love Yourself' was written by Ed Sheeran and Benny Blanco, and produced by the latter.
